FuncDef:
The redirect ip-nexthop if-match command enables traffic redirection based on a specified application ID in a service chain instance.
The undo redirect ip-nexthop if-match command disables traffic redirection based on a specified application ID in a service chain instance.
By default, traffic redirection based on an application ID is not enabled in a service chain instance.
CLIs: redirect ip-nexthop <ip-address> { forward | reverse } if-match application-id <application-id>
undo redirect ip-nexthop <ip-address> { forward | reverse } if-match application-id <application-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a next-hop IPv4 address to which traffic is redirected.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Indicates redirection of the traffic sent from the private network to the public network.
-

Indicates redirection of the traffic from the public network to the private network.
-

Specifies an application ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 8.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If traffic that passes through a service chain needs to be redirected, run the redirect ip-nexthop if-match command in the service chain instance.
Prerequisites
A service chain instance has been created.
Precautions
Redirecting traffic that matches a specified application ID takes effect only after the next hop of a service chain instance is bound to an SA instance.A maximum of eight redirect ip-nexthop if-match command instances can be run in each service chain instance.All redirect ip-nexthop if-match command instances in a service chain instance must support the same direction specified by either the forward or reverse parameter.When a service chain instance has multiple configurations of redirection for traffic matching application IDs, all application IDs must be unique.Redirection configured in a service chain instance is mutually exclusive with redirection configured in a NAT instance.
